questions.text: A 60-year-old man with a history of kidney transplantation two years ago presents to the emergency department with fever, weight loss, and a productive cough for the past week. He is currently on immunosuppressive therapy. Physical examination shows crackles over the lung fields and a chest X-ray reveals multiple nodular infiltrates. A Gram stain of the sputum is shown below. Which of the following characteristics is most likely demonstrated by the organism causing this patient's symptoms?
A 21 years old patient Suyash came to OPD with history of fall on hand. Now he is having pain at hand region. X ray of patient is given. Which of the following joint has been shown in his X ray ?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Ellipsoid joint

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The radiocarpal (wrist) joint is an ellipsoid joint that allows a variety of movements, including flexion, extension, abduction, and adduction. This makes it unique from other joint types like hinge or saddle joints.
  • ➤ radiocarpal (wrist) joint
  • ➤ ellipsoid joint

questions.text: Which of the following vessels is implicated in the following pathology?
The position that best describes the location of coeliac plexus:

A 24-year-old female presents to your office with burning urination, urgency and frequency. She is sexually active. Urine cultures show catalase-positive, gram-positive cocci. The organism responsible for this patient's symptoms is most likely to be:
All are Koch’s postulates except:

options.label: A
options.text: A microorganism should be constantly associated with the lesions of the disease

options.label: B
options.text: It should be possible to isolate the bacterium in pure culture from the lesions

options.label: C
options.text: Inoculation of such pure culture into laboratory animals should reproduce the lesions

options.label: D
options.text: Administration of broad-spectrum antimicrobial agent dependably eradicates the organisms and cures the diseases

questions.correct_answer: D. Administration of broad-spectrum antimicrobial agent dependably eradicates the organisms and cures the diseases
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Administration of broad-spectrum antimicrobial agent dependably eradicates the organisms and cures the diseases

questions.text: Match the following intracranial aneurysms with their Characteristic features:
What is the typical fiber arrangement of lumbrical muscles in the hand?

options.label: A
options.text: 1 st & 2 nd lumbricals – Unipennate, 3 rd & 4 th lumbricals - bipennate

options.label: B
options.text: 1 st & 2 nd lumbricals – bipennate, 3 rd & 4 th lumbricals - unipennate

options.label: C
options.text: 1 st & 3 rd lumbricals – bipennate, 2 nd & 4 th lumbricals - unipennate

options.label: D
options.text: 2 nd & 3 rd lumbricals – bipennate, 1 st & 4 th lumbricals - unipennate

questions.correct_answer: A. 1 st & 2 nd lumbricals – Unipennate, 3 rd & 4 th lumbricals - bipennate
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 1st& 2ndlumbricals – Unipennate, 3rd& 4thlumbricals – bipennate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The lumbrical muscles of the hand have a unipennate arrangement for the 1st and 2nd lumbricals and a bipennate arrangement for the 3rd and 4th lumbricals. This fiber arrangement is crucial for the fine motor control of the fingers.
  • ➤ lumbrical muscles
  • ➤ unipennate
  • ➤ bipennate

questions.text: A 52-year-old man comes to the OPD with 3 weeks of cough, night sweats, and occasional hemoptysis. The patient also has type 2 diabetes mellitus and hypertension. Sputum cultures grown on a selective medium demonstrate mycobacteria that grow in parallel chains forming serpentine cords under microscopy. This observed growth pattern most strongly correlates with which of the following bacterial characteristics?

Fourth-year medical students are recruited for a research study assessing their ability to interpret biopsy samples obtained during routine clinical practice. As part of the study, they are given samples of normal respiratory mucosa and asked to identify the cell types present after staining with hematoxylin and eosin. The students observe that the respiratory epithelium changes in composition as the airways continue distally from the trachea to the alveolar ducts. Which of the following features is last to disappear?
Image depicted below belongs to which of the following?
All of the following muscles have dual nerve supply except?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Pronator teres

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Pronator teres muscle is not a hybrid muscle, as it is supplied solely by the median nerve , while all the other muscles in the question (subscapularis, pectoralis major, flexor digitorum profundus) receive dual nerve supply.
  • ➤ Pronator teres
  • ➤ median nerve

questions.text: Which of the following assertions about Legionella pneumonia is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Aspiration is an important mode of transmission

options.label: B
options.text: Legionella antigens in the urine is the gold standard of diagnosis

options.label: C
options.text: Legionnaires disease is also known as Pontiac fever

questions.correct_answer: B. Legionella antigens in the urine is the gold standard of diagnosis
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Legionella antigens in the urine is the gold standard of diagnosis

questions.text: From which of the following is the marked “C” structure derived from?

A virologist is researching acyclovir-resistant herpes simplex virus (HSV). Viral DNA analysis reveals a mutation in the thymidine kinase gene, resulting in a mutated enzyme that does not phosphorylate acyclovir to its active form. In an experiment, a resistant HSV type 2 strain containing this mutation is cultured in a cell line, and the cell culture is coinfected with a nonresistant HSV type 1 strain. It is found that some of the newly produced type 1 virions acquire resistance to acyclovir, and subsequent progeny continue to be resistant. Which of the following mechanisms best explains the observed findings?
Galactomanan in serum is seen in? Invasive Aspergillosis Systemic candidiasis Mucormycosis Cryptococcosis
What is the blood supply of the structure marked?

A 45-year-old office worker complains of persistent wrist pain and difficulty performing repetitive tasks on a computer keyboard. Physical examination reveals tenderness at the wrist joint and decreased range of motion, particularly during wrist flexion and extension. Radiographic evaluation shows evidence of degenerative changes in the joint space. Which of the following bones is not directly involved in the formation of the wrist joint ?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Ulna

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The ulna is not directly involved in the wrist joint due to the triangular fibrocartilage complex (TFCC) , which separates it from the carpal bones. The wrist joint is primarily formed by the radius , scaphoid , lunate , and partially the triquetral bones.
  • ➤ ulna
  • ➤ triangular fibrocartilage complex (TFCC)
  • ➤ radius
  • ➤ scaphoid
  • ➤ lunate
  • ➤ triquetral

questions.text: An elderly woman reports difficulty in buttoning her shirt and increased clumsiness in performing daily activities. On examination, the clinician asked her to make an 'O' using her thumb and index finger, which she was unable to do. Which of the following muscles is involved?

A 32-year-old man comes to the OPD for a follow-up appointment. The patient recently returned from a 10-day trip to Thailand. On the fifth day of his trip, he developed malaise, anorexia, and abdominal cramps, quickly followed by watery diarrhea. The patient had 5 or 6 stools daily but no fever. The patient felt better after 2 days and has had no additional symptoms since. Which of the following factors was most likely involved in the pathogenesis of this patient's gastrointestinal symptoms?

A child is presented with fever, conjunctivitis and bluish white spot-on buccal mucosa. Four days later, she developed rashes. What is the characteristic feature of the virus that is responsible for this condition?

A 40-year-old man presents with a complaint of dragging his foot while walking. On examination, he demonstrates difficulty in dorsiflexing his foot at the ankle. This clinical presentation is most likely due to a lesion affecting which nerve?
Identify the marked structure:
Which of the following is true regarding the anatomy of the breast?

options.label: A
options.text: Tail of spence extends across anterior axillary fold.

options.label: B
options.text: Inner quadrants of breast contain the most breast tissue

options.label: C
options.text: The suspensory ligaments of cooper's ligaments are found in the lower part of breast.

options.label: D
options.text: Breast is made up of 10 lobes

questions.correct_answer: A. Tail of spence extends across anterior axillary fold.
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Tail of spence extends across anterior axillary fold

questions.text: A 26-year-old man comes to the OPD due to a 3-day-history of dysuria and urethral discharge. The symptoms developed about 2 weeks after he had unprotected sexual intercourse with a new partner. Gram stain of the discharge is shown. A sample of the discharge is placed on an antibiotic-containing medium, and bacterial colonies are cultured. Which of the following terms best describes the medium?

During examination of a patient with an intern, the professor asks the patient to invert his foot and he points at the prominent tendon behind the medial malleolus. Which is the tendon being pointed at here?
Mesencephalic nucleus of trigeminal nerve receives which of the following sensation?

A 22-year-old athlete presents with pain in the posterior aspect of his hip after a sprinting injury. On examination, the pain is localized to the ischial tuberosity. Which of the following muscles is most likely involved, given its attachment to the ischial tuberosity?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Biceps Femoris

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The ischial tuberosity serves as the origin for the hamstring muscles , including the biceps femoris , which is commonly injured in sprinting-related activities due to its role in knee flexion and hip extension. Among the options, biceps femoris is the most likely muscle involved in this injury.
  • ➤ ischial tuberosity
  • ➤ hamstring muscles
  • ➤ biceps femoris
  • ➤ biceps femoris

questions.text: A group of hostel boys consumed hamburgers from a local street food shop following which they developed abdominal pain, diarrhoea, vomiting, and fever. They were diagnosed with hemolytic uremic syndrome (HUS). Escherichia coli 0157:H7 was detected in the stool samples. What does H represent in H7?

A 45-year-old man comes to the physician due to pain, swelling, and erythema affecting his right leg. He says that he suffered a minor cut to his leg a few days ago while cleaning his garage. He is diagnosed with cellulitis and started on the appropriate treatment. Gram stain of the exudate shows gram-positive cocci in clusters. The organism most likely responsible for this patient's infection synthesizes a protein A as part of its peptidoglycan cell wall that does which of the following?

options.label: B
options.text: Binds the Fc portion of lgG

questions.correct_answer: B. Binds the Fc portion of lgG
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Binds the Fc portion of lgG

questions.text: Identify the organism which shows effacement and attachment of intestinal cells as shown below?
Injury to the nerve that lies medially to the structure pointed will result in?

options.label: A
options.text: Loss of taste sensation from anterior 2/3 tongue

options.label: B
options.text: Loss of taste sensation from posterior 1/3 tongue

options.label: C
options.text: Loss of general sensation from anterior 2/3 tongue

options.label: D
options.text: Loss of taste sensation from posterior most part of tongue

questions.correct_answer: A. Loss of taste sensation from anterior 2/3 tongue
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Loss of taste sensation from anterior 2/3 tongue

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The chorda tympani nerve is responsible for taste sensation from the anterior 2/3 of the tongue . Injury to the nerve medially related to the structure in the image results in the loss of taste sensation from the anterior 2/3 of the tongue , making A the correct answer.
  • ➤ chorda tympani nerve
  • ➤ taste sensation from the anterior 2/3 of the tongue
  • ➤ loss of taste sensation from the anterior 2/3 of the tongue
  • ➤ A

questions.text: 35-year-old man presented with high fever, bleeding gums, myalgia, and hepatosplenomegaly. His TLC is 3100, Hb- 11 g/dl, hematocrit- 55%, and platelets - 25,000 cells. What is the most important prognostic factor in this condition?
On palpation at the site marked by arrow on the image, a bony ridge is felt. What is the vertebral level of the marked arrow?

A 22-year-old man with fever and joint pain is found to have a disease caused by an enveloped virus containing partially double-stranded circular DNA. An enzyme packed in its virion has RNA-dependent DNA-polymerase activity. This patient is most likely infected with which of the following viruses?
Which among the following is not a branch of ECA in Kiesselbach’s plexus:

An elderly female with a central line undergoes surgery. On postoperative day 3, she develops fever and tachycardia. A culture from the tip of the central line revealed brown buff colonies. Microscopy showed gram-positive organisms that reproduce by budding. What is the likely causative organism?
Identify the epithelium:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Keratinized stratified squamous epithelium

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The keratinized stratified squamous epithelium is a defining feature of the skin's epidermis , offering protection against mechanical stress, dehydration, and microbial invasion.
  • ➤ keratinized stratified squamous epithelium
  • ➤ skin's epidermis

questions.text: Which nerve does not provide nerve supply to gluteal area?

A 25-year-old woman comes to the emergency department due to 2 days of abdominal pain and bloody diarrhea. Stool cultures reveal an Escherichia coli strain that does not produce glucuronidase and does not ferment sorbitol on sorbitol-containing MacConkey agar. Which of the following best describes the mechanism of action of the toxin specific to these bacteria?
Sensation of which of the following structures are affected if a tumor or lesion compresses the structures passing through this opening of the skull marked A?

options.label: C
options.text: Sensation in anterior scalp and dorsum of nose

questions.correct_answer: C. Sensation in anterior scalp and dorsum of nose
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Sensation in anterior scalp and dorsum of nose

questions.text: In given radiological anatomy image identify the thalamus?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) C

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In radiological anatomy, the thalamus is identified as the large, centrally located structure, marked as C in this image.
  • ➤ thalamus
  • ➤ C

questions.text: A farmer presenting with fever off and on for the past 4 years was diagnosed to be suffering from chronic brucellosis. All of the following serological tests would be helpful in the diagnosis at this state except:
Identify the muscle shown:

A 35-year-old woman, gravida 1, para 0, at 12 weeks gestation comes to the OPD for evaluation of genital warts. Examination shows several verrucous, skin-colored lesions over the labia majora. The patient asks whether the lesion could affect her future child. The virus involved in this patient's condition also has an affinity to infect which of the following structures?
Which of the following papillae do not have taste buds?
What is the proper pairing between the anatomical limits of lymph nodes and the Level of lymph nodes?

options.label: C
options.text: Level 5: Base of skull to cricoid

questions.correct_answer: D. Level 6: Hyoid to suprasternal notch
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Level 6: Hyoid to suprasternal notch

questions.text: Most lateral nucleus of cerebellum?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Dentate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The dentate nucleus is the most lateral and largest nucleus of the cerebellum and is essential for motor coordination.
  • ➤ dentate nucleus
  • ➤ most lateral and largest nucleus

questions.text: What is the outer covering of the condition shown in the image?

A 20-year-old woman comes to a PHC due to pain with intercourse and dysuria for the last 3 days. She also has had low-grade fevers and a mild headache. Pelvic examination shows multiple, painful, shallow ulcers with an erythematous base on the left labium. No vaginal discharge is present. Bimanual examination reveals no cervical motion tenderness. There is bilateral tender inguinal lymphadenopathy. Which of the following is the best diagnostic test for this patient's condition?

options.label: B
options.text: Gram stain of the ulcer swab

questions.text: An army jawan posted in remote forest area following a tick bite had fever and headache. His fever was 104 °F and pulse was 70 per min. He had an erythematous lesion of about 1 cm on the leg surrounded by small vesicles, along with generalized lymphadenopathy at the time of presentation to the referral hospital. His blood sample was collected to perform serology for the diagnosis of Rickettsial disease. Which one of the following results in Weil-Felix reaction will be diagnostic in this clinical setting?
Which type of gland is depicted here?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Holocrine glands

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The gland shown in the image is a holocrine gland , specifically a sebaceous gland, characterized by the disintegration of cells to release oily secretions.
  • ➤ holocrine gland

questions.text: A sesamoid bone called Fabella is embedded in tendon of:
In the cross section given below, locate the vagus nerve:

A 55-year-old man comes to the OPD for evaluation of progressive watery diarrhea for the last 2 weeks. The patient has a history of kidney transplantation 5 years ago due to polycystic kidney disease and currently takes multiple immunosuppressive medications. Stool microscopy is shown below. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's current condition?
An absent gag reflex can result from injury to which nerve?
A young man presents with skin lesions as shown in the image below. All of the following organisms can spread through dermal and subcutaneous lymphatics, except:
Your patient has lost the ability to discriminate between two points presented simultaneously to the skin. Your neurological evaluation is most likely to reveal a lesion in the
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Medial lemniscus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The medial lemniscus is part of the dorsal column pathway, responsible for fine touch, proprioception, and two-point discrimination. Damage to this structure results in the loss of two-point discrimination ability.
  • ➤ medial lemniscus

questions.text: Which artery is used for arteriovenous shunting with the great saphenous vein for haemodialysis & that artery present behind medial malleolus and 2.5 cm in front of tendo-calcaneus?

A 32-year-old woman comes to the OPD due to a small amount of malodorous vaginal discharge. She is sexually active with a male partner and uses condoms sporadically. She drinks a glass of wine every night with dinner and has had an abnormal Pap test in the past. Speculum examination reveals thin, gray discharge. Wet mount microscopy of the discharge shows large, atypical vaginal epithelial cells and no protozoa. Application of potassium hydroxide solution to the discharge yields a strong odor. Which of the following is the best treatment option for this patient?
A patient presented to the hospital with severe hydrophobia. Corneal scrapings from the patient is obtained. What test should be done on this specimen for a diagnosis of Rabies?

options.label: C
options.text: Antibodies to rabies virus by Indirect Immunofluorescence

questions.text: A patient has suffered a stroke caused by occlusion of the right anterior cerebral artery. This patient is most likely to present with

options.label: A
options.text: A loss of pain and temperature sensations in the left leg

options.label: C
options.text: Drooping of the corner of the mouth on the left

questions.correct_answer: A. A loss of pain and temperature sensations in the left leg
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) A loss of pain and temperature sensations in the left leg

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Occlusion of the anterior cerebral artery causes deficits in the contralateral lower limb due to its supply to the medial surface of the brain, which includes motor and sensory areas associated with the lower extremities. In this case, the loss of pain and temperature sensations in the left leg is the most likely clinical manifestation.
  • ➤ anterior cerebral artery
  • ➤ contralateral lower limb
  • ➤ loss of pain and temperature sensations in the left leg

questions.text: Histology of the nodules shows the following findings. Which of the following is true regarding this condition?

options.label: B
options.text: Infection can spread and involve underlying subcutaneous tissue, tendon, muscle or joints

options.label: C
options.text: Angioinvasion is common especially in people with hemolytic anemia

options.label: D
options.text: These bodies are formed by engulfment of the dead fungi by the macrophages

questions.correct_answer: A. It is a dematiaceous fungus
questions.explanation: Ans. A) It is a dematiaceous fungus

questions.text: A 38-year-old patient presents with sudden-onset facial weakness and drooping on one side of the face. The patient also complains of drooling while eating, likely due to weakness in a muscle. Which of the following structures does not pierce the involved muscle?
questions.correct_answer: A. Buccal branch of facial nerve
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Buccal branch of facial nerve

questions.text: A 55-year-old male presents with fever, night sweats, weight loss, diarrhea, and generalized weakness. Physical examination shows mucosal pallor, generalized lymphadenopathy, and hepatosplenomegaly. Laboratory studies reveal anemia and elevated alkaline phosphatase and lactate dehydrogenase levels. CD4 count is 16/mm. Bone marrow biopsy shows aggregates of epithelioid histiocytes with foamy cytoplasm and numerous acid-fast intracellular organisms. Nucleic acid amplification test of the sample for Mycobacterium tuberculosis is negative. Which of the following pathogens is the most likely cause of this patient's illness?

A 30-year-old man came to the OPD with a febrile illness of 2 days, associated with abdominal tenderness, malaise and diarrhoea. He had a fever with bradycardia and BP was noted as 110/70 mmHg. Best diagnostic test to confirm the pathogen is:
Identify the tarsal bone as labelled in the image given:
A tumor of the uncinate process of the pancreas affects which of the following vessels?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Superior mesenteric artery

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A tumor in the uncinate process of the pancreas primarily affects the superior mesenteric artery and vein due to their close anatomical relationship.

questions.text: Superior gluteal nerve supplies all except?

A 2-week-old boy is brought to the OPD due to runny nose, low-grade fever, and skin rash for 2 days. The patient was born at 38 weeks gestation to a 19-year-old woman who had poor access to prenatal care. Temperature is 38° C (100.4° F). Vital signs are otherwise normal for age. On examination, the patient has nasal drainage and peeling skin on his face, hands, and feet. Hepatosplenomegaly and generalized lymphadenopathy are present. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 40-year-old farmer came with fever, calf tenderness, conjunctival suffusion, retro orbital pain. On examination, he has severe calf tenderness. Lab investigations show hypokalaemia and neutropenia. What is the diagnosis?
GSE fibres are present in cranial nerves:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) III, IV, VI, XII

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ GSE fibers are found in cranial nerves III (Oculomotor), IV (Trochlear), VI (Abducens), and XII (Hypoglossal), as they control skeletal muscles derived from somites.

questions.text: All of the following interaction occurs between antigen antibody reaction except:
Which of the following does not play a role in movement of the eyeball?

A 29-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department with new-onset generalized tonic-clonic seizures. She has a history of HIV and has not been taking her medications consistently. According to her family, she has been sleepy and weak for the past 2 weeks. MRI is shown. Which of the following would be effective against the pathogen most likely responsible for this patient's symptoms?

A patient with a history of consumption of oysters comes with complaints of nausea, vomiting and crampy abdominal pain. The culture of the organism showed the Kanagawa phenomenon. What is the causative organism?
The left ureter does not have a relation with which of the following structures?

Which of the following are branches of the anterior division of the internal iliac artery? Superior gluteal artery Inferior gluteal artery Superior vesical artery Middle rectal artery Inferior vesical artery Vaginal artery
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 2, 3, 4, 5, 6

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The anterior division of the internal iliac artery supplies the pelvic cavity (bladder, rectum, vagina, prostate) and includes branches such as the inferior gluteal, superior vesical, middle rectal, inferior vesical, and vaginal arteries.

questions.text: Which is the mode of transmission and infective form of the parasite whose egg picture is given below?

options.label: B
options.text: Ingestion of egg contaminated in water

questions.correct_answer: B. Ingestion of egg contaminated in water
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Ingestion of egg contaminated in water

questions.text: A 6-hour-old boy is evaluated in the newborn nursery due to temperature instability, grunting, and lethargy. The patient was born at full term to a 21-year-old woman who came to the emergency department in active labor with ruptured membranes; she had not received adequate prenatal care. On physical examination, the boy is hypothermic, tachycardic, and tachypneic, and he has mottled skin. Cultures on blood agar grow bacterial colonies with a narrow zone of clear hemolysis. When these bacteria are grown in the presence of Staphylococcus aureus, the zone of hemolysis is enhanced around the staphylococcal colonies. Which of the following is the most likely pathogen infecting this patient?

A 21-year-old female complains of fever, headache and vomiting from the past 3 days. She has been living in the army recruitment camp for the last three weeks. On examination, she has neck stiffness and a maculopapular rash was noted over the trunk and extremities. Which of the following is false about the disease she's likely suffering from?

options.label: A
options.text: Carriers of this disease can be treated with Rifampicin

options.label: B
options.text: It can lead to adrenal hemorrhage

options.label: C
options.text: Terminal complement deficiency increases the risk of this disease

options.label: D
options.text: Metronidazole is the drug of choice

questions.correct_answer: D. Metronidazole is the drug of choice
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Metronidazole is the drug of choice

questions.text: Which among the following does not constitute a part of superficial perineal pouch?
Arrange the neural columns in medial to lateral order in the floor of the fourth ventricle. General somatic afferent General visceral afferent Special somatic afferent Special visceral afferent
The deep cervical fascia’s pretracheal layer encloses everything except:

A 40-year-old woman is evaluated for extreme weakness, headache, blurry vision, and difficulty swallowing and opening her eyes over the past several hours. Her husband has similar symptoms and is being evaluated in the emergency department as well. One day earlier, they both developed abdominal cramps and diarrhea after attending a lunch event. Upper extremities are weaker than the lower extremities. Sensation is intact throughout. Which of the following is the most likely source of this patient's infection?
All of the following statements about the marked muscle are correct except:

options.label: A
options.text: Retracts the scapula along with the middle fibres of trapezius

options.label: B
options.text: Elevates the scapula along with fibres of trapezius

options.label: C
options.text: Rotates the scapula so that glenoid cavity tilts inferiorly

options.label: D
options.text: Rotates the scapula so that glenoid cavity tilts superiorly

questions.correct_answer: D. Rotates the scapula so that glenoid cavity tilts superiorly
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Rotates the scapula so that glenoid cavity tilts superiorly

questions.text: Which of the following does not serve as the uterine support?

A 44 yr old female presents to the OPD with high grade fever, pain that is constant, throbbing, and worse when sitting down with history of constipation in the past. Fluctuation is noted near the anal region. The Resident decides to drain the ischioanal abscess. Which of the following structures can be injured while draining the ischioanal abscess?

Following parvovirus related manifestations are given. Identify the incorrect pair ? Pure red cell aplasia-Chronic haemolytic anemia Polymyalgia rheumatic-Young women Hydops fetalis- Pregnant women Erythema infectiosum- Infants Non erosive arthritis –Patients of SLE

A 48-year-old previously healthy man is evaluated for progressive fatigue, exertional dyspnea, and excessive bruising. Bone marrow biopsy confirms acute myeloid leukemia. The patient receives induction chemotherapy. Four days after completion of chemotherapy, the patient develops fever and malaise. New clusters of macular skin lesions are noted. Blood cultures grow smooth, creamy white, glistening colonies of small yeast forms. Incubating the pathogen in human serum at 37 C for 2-3 hours is shown below. Which of the following is the most likely organism responsible for this patient's condition?

A 25-year-old female complains of recurrent rhinitis, nasal discharge and bilateral nasal blockage since 2 years. She has history of asthma and allergy. On examination multiple ethmoidal polyps are noted with mucosal thickening and impacted secretions in both the nasal cavities. Biopsy is taken and the material is cultured which shown the growth of many hyphae with dichotomous branching typically at 45. Which of the following is the most likely responsible organism?
The diaphragm’s esophageal hiatus is not traversed by which of the following?
Which of the following vessels is involved in the condition affecting the region marked in red?
Which of these is not a branch of facial artery?

A 48-year-old homeless man is brought to the emergency department after being found unresponsive on the sidewalk. The patient is ill- appearing, thin, and disheveled with poor dentition. There are a few white patches on the oral mucosa, but no skin rash is present. Lung auscultation reveals bilateral crackles. Chest x-ray reveals bilateral interstitial infiltrates. A silver-stained bronchoalveolar lavage specimen is shown in the image. Which of the following most likely predisposed this patient to his current lung condition?
Which organism is transmitted by the vector shown in the image except?

An isolate from a cancer patient in the critical care unit is found to be resistant to meropenem and aminoglycosides and sensitive to cotrimoxazole, ticarcillin-clavulanic acid. What is the likely microorganism involved?
Which of the following spermatic cord structures is not harmed during vasectomy?

A patient with a history of bone marrow transplant presented with cough and chest heaviness for the last 2 weeks. Chest X-ray showed consolidation in the lung. A lung biopsy was obtained. On microscopic examination of the biopsy, the organism appeared as shown in the image. Identify the pathogen involved?

A 52-year-old active smoker comes to the OPD due to a 2-week history of malaise, shortness of breath, and decreased appetite. The patient has a history of bicuspid aortic valve and hypertension. On examination, the patient has a systolic ejection murmur at the right upper sternal border that is unchanged from previous visits; there is a new decrescendo diastolic murmur best heard in the third intercostal space at the left sternal border. Blood cultures are positive for Streptococcus gallolyticus. Additional workup for this patient should focus on which of the following conditions?
Correct sequence of bacterial growth curve:

options.label: A
options.text: Log phase – Lag Phase – Stationary phase – Decline phase

options.label: B
options.text: Lag Phase – Log phase – Stationary phase – Decline phase

options.label: C
options.text: Stationary phase – Log phase – Lag Phase – Decline phase

questions.explanation: Ans. B) Lag Phase – Log phase – Stationary phase – Decline phase

questions.text: Level of posterior superior iliac spine:
A renal transplant patient on immunosuppressive drugs develops redness on his hand, which later spreads to his entire hand. Mason-Fontana stain is positive. What is the likely fungal organism?
A medical student was yawning during his afternoon anatomy lecture. His jaw got arrested while yawning. Which muscle aids in relocation of the jaw?

A 45-year-old woman comes to the OPD for follow-up of type 2 diabetes mellitus. The patient is taking the maximum dose of metformin. Her hemoglobinA1c is 7.7%. Blood pressure is 134/86 mm Hg, and pulse is 72/min. BMI is 33 kg/m2. Family history is significant for osteoporosis in mother. The results of other laboratory tests are normal. After discussion, a sodium-glucose cotransporter-2 inhibitor is added to the patient's drug regimen. Which of the following is the most likely additional effect of the newly prescribed medication?
TLR3 and AXL receptors are associated with?
A 36-year-old woman is referred for evaluation because of hematuria and haemoptysis since 2 weeks. DLCO is 120% of normal with normal lung volumes. What is the likely diagnosis in this patient?
Which nerve is affected when there is referred pain from ureteric colic felt in the groin?

A 17-year-old boy presents with sudden-onset palpitations and lightheadedness while playing video games. He states this has occurred intermittently over the past year, but the episodes typically resolve spontaneously after a few minutes. He denies chest pain, shortness of breath, or syncope. ECG is shown below. Which of the following abnormalities is most likely present in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Accessory pathway bypassing the AV node

options.label: B
options.text: Degeneration of the atrioventricular conduction system

questions.text: A 46-year-old man is brought to the emergency department by paramedics after an episode of large-volume hematemesis. Physical examination reveals a palpable spleen. Endoscopy shows bleeding esophageal varices. A liver biopsy performed 2 days later shows no abnormalities. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's condition?

A 23-year-old female presents with fever and altered sensorium for two days with the following rash on legs. Her BP is 70/50 mm Hg and neck stiffness is present. Lumbar puncture reveals cloudy turbid CSF with 4200 cells/uL, Protein level 168 and Glucose of 21 mg/dL. Which of the following correctly describes the organism causing this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Gram Negative Diplococci (kidney shaped), Oxidase positive

options.label: B
options.text: Gram Negative Diplococci, ferments glucose and maltose

options.label: C
options.text: Gram Positive cocci catalase negative, bacitracin sensitive

options.label: D
options.text: Gram Positive Diplococci (lanceolate), catalase negative, optochin sensitive

questions.correct_answer: B. Gram Negative Diplococci, ferments glucose and maltose
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Gram Negative Diplococci, ferments glucose and maltose

questions.text: Which of the following statement is true about valve of Houston?

options.label: A
options.text: The middle valve corresponds to the middle convex fold to the right.

options.label: B
options.text: The upper valve corresponds to peritoneal reflections.

options.label: C
options.text: The valve contain all three layers of muscle wall.

options.label: D
options.text: Valves disappear after mobilisation of rectum

questions.correct_answer: D. Valves disappear after mobilisation of rectum
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Valves disappear after mobilisation of rectum

questions.text: Select the one which doesn’t cause Urethritis in males:

A 13-year-old boy comes to the clinic due to shortness of breath and fatigue over the past 2 weeks. He reports significant weight gain, swelling around the ankles, and profound fatigue. Laboratory findings include red blood cell casts in urine and elevated creatinine. Immunofluorescence microscopy shown. Which of the following light microscopy findings is most likely to be seen in this patient’s renal biopsy?
Where does the supra duodenal bile duct’s primary blood supply come from?

A 35-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department due to severe right leg pain. Right-sided dorsalis pedis and posterior tibial pulses are absent, and the popliteal pulse is barely palpable. Emergency embolectomy is performed and a gelatinous mass causing arterial occlusion is successfully removed. Histopathologic section of the mass is shown in the image below. Which of the following is the most likely origin of this patient's embolus?

A group of researchers is studying the variability in drug metabolism across individuals using isoniazid. Variation in which of the following metabolic processes is the most likely explanation for this observation?

options.label: A
options.text: Loss of sensation around the orbit

options.label: C
options.text: Infection spreads to cavernous sinus from the danger area of face via inferior ophthalmic vein.

options.label: D
options.text: Superior ophthalmic vein serves as a both incoming as well as outgoing channel to cavernous sinus because it is valveless.

questions.text: Which of the following changes are most likely to occur in this patient’s kidney function after starting therapy with NSAID?

options.label: A
options.text: Decreased renal perfusion, decreased intraglomerular pressure, and constant filtration fraction

options.label: B
options.text: Increased renal perfusion, decreased intraglomerular pressure, and decreased filtration fraction

options.label: C
options.text: Decreased renal perfusion, increased intraglomerular pressure, and decreased filtration fraction

options.label: D
options.text: Decreased renal perfusion, decreased intraglomerular pressure, and reduced filtration fraction

questions.correct_answer: A. Decreased renal perfusion, decreased intraglomerular pressure, and constant filtration fraction
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Decreased renal perfusion, decreased intraglomerular pressure, and constant filtration fraction

questions.text: Which of the following are features of severe dengue: AST and ALT are more than 1000 IU Hepatomegaly >1cm Leucopenia plus thrombocytopenia Severe bleeding Vomiting

A new aminoglycoside antibiotic is developed that is believed to be particularly effective against Pseudomonas. The volume of distribution of the drug is measured in a group of volunteers and is determined to be 4.5 L. This new drug is most likely to have which of the following properties?

options.label: C
options.text: It does not bind to albumin

True about cholera: There’s no role of mass prophylaxis in cholera outbreak Dukoral vaccine can be given for age less than 2 years Dukoral vaccine is Monovalent Shanchol Vaccine is Bivalent Gastric buffer is added in shanchol vaccine 5% Cresol is used for disinfecting Feces, vomitus during outbreaks

His sputum was sent to the laboratory for gram straining which showed the presence of pus cells and gram-positive cocci in pair. Which of the following will help in confirming the diagnosis?
Which of the following is false about Anatomy of Adrenal gland?

options.label: A
options.text: Adrenals are yellow in gross appearance

options.label: C
options.text: Right adrenal is semilunar in shape

options.label: D
options.text: Left adrenal is related medially to coeliac ganglion

questions.correct_answer: C. Right adrenal is semilunar in shape
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Right adrenal is semilunar in shape.

questions.text: 23-year-old man undergoes exercise physiology testing. He jogs on a treadmill to achieve a moderate-intensity physical activity level based on a target heart rate of 50%-70% of his estimated maximum heart rate. Which of the following is expected at peak exercise?

options.label: A
options.text: PaCo2 normal, PaO2 normal, pH decreases, PvCo2 high, PvO2 low

options.label: B
options.text: PaCo2 low, PaO2 normal, pH decreases, PvCo2 high, PvO2 low

options.label: C
options.text: PaCo2 high, PaO2 low, pH increases, PvCo2 high, PvO2 low

options.label: D
options.text: PaCo2 low, PaO2 low, pH normal, PvCo2 high, PvO2 low

questions.correct_answer: B. PaCo2 low, PaO2 normal, pH decreases, PvCo2 high, PvO2 low
questions.explanation: Ans. B) PaCo2 low, PaO2 normal, pH decreases, PvCo2 high, PvO2 low

questions.text: A 40-year-old nulligravida woman comes to the office with a 2-month history of worsening right pelvic pain. She experiences the pain daily, and its intensity does not vary during her menstrual cycle. In addition, the patient's waist size has increased despite a decreased appetite. Pelvic examination shows an irregularly shaped, fixed adnexal mass. One week later, she undergoes surgery to remove a large ovarian neoplasm. Within the true pelvis, the surgeon can most likely palpate the right ureter immediately anterior to which of the following structures?

A 6-month-old boy is evaluated due to cough for 2 weeks. The patient has not received vaccinations. Temperature is 37.1° C (98.8° F), blood pressure is 98/66 mm Hg, and respirations are 30/min. Oxygen saturation is 98%. On physical examination, when the patient coughs intermittently, his face turns red. The lungs are clear to auscultation. Leukocyte count is 22,000/mm (75% lymphocytes). The most effective pharmacotherapy for this patient's condition will directly interfere with which of the following cellular processes?

A 29-year-old woman comes to the OPD due to 2 weeks of severe, progressive joint pain in her hands, wrists, and ankles. The patient has no medical conditions but developed a high fever and diffuse rash on her trunk and extremities during a trip. Laboratory testing reveals lymphopenia. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's joint pain?

options.label: A
options.text: Acute joint inflammation from crystal deposition

options.label: D
options.text: Viral infection transmitted by mosquito bite

questions.correct_answer: D. Viral infection transmitted by mosquito bite
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Viral infection transmitted by mosquito bite

Assertion : Late trophozoite and schizont not usually seen in falciparum in peripheral smear. Reason : Late trophozoite and schizonts are attached to the capillary endothelium of the blood vessels.

options.label: A
options.text: Assertion is true, reason is true - reason is the correct explanation for the assertion

options.label: B
options.text: Assertion is true, reason is true - reason is not the correct explanation for the assertion

options.label: C
options.text: Assertion is false and the reason is true

options.label: D
options.text: Assertion is true and the reason is false

questions.correct_answer: A. Assertion is true, reason is true - reason is the correct explanation for the assertion
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Assertion is true, reason is true - reason is the correct explanation for the assertion
